medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric pain, vomiting, diarrhea, anemia, and acute kidney injury.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 3 weeks before admission with vomiting, diarrhea, fevers, arthralgias, and increasing episodes of epigastric pain. Two weeks prior to admission, the epigastric and midabdominal pain worsened, with diarrhea and one episode of vomiting. Pain was rated at 4 on a scale of 0 to 10, worse when lying flat.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Labile hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, allergic rhinitis, possible gastroesophageal reflux disease, urinary tract infection in the past, history of ovarian cysts and bilateral pulmonary nodules.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of esophageal cancer; grandfather and paternal aunt had lymphoma; maternal cousins had sarcoma and lung cancer; mother and children healthy, no family history of renal or rheumatologic diseases.
medical_history.social_history: Married, retired, physically active; drinks alcohol in moderation, does not smoke or use illicit drugs; no recent foreign travel; husband and friends had transient gastroenteritis.
